docs.snippet: South Carolina Gov. Nikki Haley, after the massacre of nine African-Americans at a historic black church in Charleston, has called for the removal of the rebel Confederate battle flag that stands outside South Carolina's Statehouse. Days earlier a...
docs.lead_paragraph: South Carolina Gov. Nikki Haley, after the massacre of nine African-Americans at a historic black church in Charleston, has called for the removal of the rebel Confederate battle flag that stands outside South Carolina's Statehouse. Days earlier authorities charged Dylann Storm Roof, 21, who is white, with murder and described the shootings as a hate crime. Roof appears in widely-seen photos holding Confederate flags, and investigators have learned that he told a friend that blacks were taking over the world and said something needed to be done for the white race. Here's a brief explanation of the Confederate battle flag, a historic but deeply divisive symbol that remains ever-present in the American South.

headline.main: AP EXPLAINS: Confederate Battle Flag, Flown Around US South
headline.print_headline: AP EXPLAINS: Confederate Battle Flag, Flown Around US South

docs.snippet: Softening longstanding policy, the Obama administration will tell families of Americans held by terror groups that they can communicate with captors and even pay ransom without fear of prosecution. The shift comes as part of a broad review of U.S....
docs.lead_paragraph: Softening longstanding policy, the Obama administration will tell families of Americans held by terror groups that they can communicate with captors and even pay ransom without fear of prosecution. The shift comes as part of a broad review of U.S. hostage guidelines that will be released Wednesday.

headline.main: US Won't Threaten to Prosecute Hostages' Families for Ransom
headline.print_headline: US Won't Threaten to Prosecute Hostages' Families for Ransom

docs.snippet: The hirings, a sharp shift for a mayor who has long been hesitant to expand the force, are a surprising addition in a $78.5 billion budget deal announced by city leaders....
docs.lead_paragraph: The hirings, a sharp shift for a mayor who has long been hesitant to expand the force, are a surprising addition in a $78.5 billion budget deal announced by city leaders.
docs.abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio is poised to hire 1,300 additional police officers as part of $78.5 billion budget reached with city leaders; de Blasio stresses that his pledge remains to also improve police-community relations.

headline.main: Mayor de Blasio Poised to Hire Nearly 1,300 Police Officers
headline.print_headline: De Blasio Is Poised to Add Officers

docs.snippet: South Carolina lawmakers voted overwhelmingly Tuesday to consider removing the Confederate flag from their Statehouse grounds and other politicians took aim at Civil War-era symbols across the South, saying change is imperative after police said n...
docs.lead_paragraph: South Carolina lawmakers voted overwhelmingly Tuesday to consider removing the Confederate flag from their Statehouse grounds and other politicians took aim at Civil War-era symbols across the South, saying change is imperative after police said nine black churchgoers were slain in a hate crime.

headline.main: SC Lawmakers Overwhelmingly Vote to Debate Confederate Flag

docs.abstract: Editorial supports South Carolina Gov Nikk Haley's urging of Legislature to take down Confederate battle flag from State Capitol grounds in response to massacre at Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston; calls on state lawmakers to act in best interest of state and honor her request.

headline.main: Take Down the Confederate Flag, Symbol of Hatred
headline.print_headline: Take Down a Symbol of Hatred
